laboratory_examinations.findings: Reduced hemoglobin (11.4 g/dL; normal, 12.0–15.5 g/dL), increased red blood cell distribution width (18.9%; normal, 11.9%–15.5%), and mild thrombocytopenia.
Reduced plasma antithrombin activity (46%; normal, 80%–130%) and antigen (41%; normal, 80%–130%) consistent with inherited type I antithrombin deficiency.
Increased TSH (6.6 mIU/L; normal, 0.3–5.5 mIU/L) and thyroid peroxidase antibodies (469 mIU/mL; normal, <9 mIU/mL), consistent with incipient hypothyroidism from Hashimoto thyroiditis.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat plasma homocysteine and TSH were normal after treatment with B12 and thyroid replacement.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Increased plasma homocysteine (99 μmol/L; normal, ≤ 13 μmol/L).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat plasma homocysteine was normal after treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Increased methylmalonic acid (19 nmol/mL; normal, ≤ 0.4 nmol/mL), consistent with vitamin B12 deficiency.
Increased antiparietal cell antibodies (84.4 U; normal, <20 U), consistent with vitamin B12 deficiency due to pernicious anemia.
